safety.definition::
[n.] 安全；安全性；平安；无危险
[网络] 保险；安规；安全第一
safety.example::
[1] Safety experts estimate that the restraining devices save more than thirteen thousand lives a year in the United States alone.
[2] In fact, all tires sold in the U. S. have to meet the same federal safety standards, and all will stand up to typical use.
[3] when the child was asleep, Hester had never felt a moment's safety: not a moment's calm enjoyment of her.

mutual.definition::
[adj.] 相互的；彼此的；共有的；共同的
[网络] 互相
mutual.example::
[1] The exact nature of the collateral should be disclosed on a regular basis, like the main investments in a mutual fund's portfolio.
[2] We are ready to work with Australia to push for positive results out of the dialogue on the basis of equality and mutual respect.
[3] We are ready to do business with you on the ~ of equality and mutual benefit.

but.definition::
[conj.] 而；然而；只有；尽管如此
[prep.] 除了；除…之外
[adv.] 只有；仅仅
[n.] 借口；托辞
[v.] 对(某人)讲“但是”(以示反对,拒绝等)
but.example::
[1] But he said being comfortable and predictable by recording the same kind of music is not the place for rock music.
[2] In his journey there was no appearance of flight, but he was fleeing, and four days afterward he was on the Zenith train.
[3] Rescuers said the injured were taken to a nearby part of the hospital, but fortunately the injury is not serious, not life threatening.

opposite.definition::
[n.] 反面；对立面；对立的人（或物）
[adj.] 对面的；另一边的；相反的；迥然不同的
[prep.] 与…相对；在…对面；与…合演；与…联袂演出
[adv.] 在对面
[网络] 在……对面；相对的；对生
opposite.example::
[1] Or, worse, I approach it from the absolute opposite end of the spectrum, as if in the very moment when a close connection shatters.
[2] When Carlson was in accord with his advisors, he might play devil's advocate to see if he could support the opposite side with logic.
[3] Bilic may therefore have had a contrast in mind when he spoke about his opposite number in tomorrow's World Cup qualifier.

embody.definition::
[v.] 体现；包含；收录；包括
[网络] 使具体化；具体表达；使具体化，具体表现
embody.example::
[1] Sinatra was a great actor so he was able to incorporate [acting] and he was able to embody the lyric and the songs, " Davi says. "
[2] These little battles seem to embody a deeper impatience with the passage of time, a perpetual desire to beat it, but for what?
[3] It would not be an exaggeration to say that the mimo concentrate and embody Yi people's conceptions of nature and of their spiritual world.

burst.definition::
[v.] 破裂；爆炸；突破；冲进
[n.] 爆发；点射；释放；(情感的)迸发
[网络] 突发；爆裂；突然发作
burst.example::
[1] I feel wrong, and in a rapid exit from the spirit of the storm, over-rapid, suddenly made my mind to have burst gaps, as if having dizzy.
[2] "When we fall we fall together, when we stand together . . . " she said. The audience burst into applause.
[3] It's a good step towards beating the afternoon doldrums thanks to that little bit of a caffeine burst and the few quiet minutes it entails.

language.definition::
[n.] 语言；言语；说话；某种类型的言语（或语言）
[网络] 语言设定；语文；语种
language.example::
[1] Street names and bus destinations could have been written in a foreign language for all the sense they made to her.
[2] However, Galileo did not care that he had found that "science is the mathematical nature of the language. "
[3] Some applications that don't support Unicode may also allow you to see text in multiple languages; others support only one language.

antarctic.definition::
[adj.] 南极(地方)的
[n.] 南极地区
[网络] 南极的；南极区；南极地带的
antarctic.example::
[1] "For whatever reason, they were still hanging out on the Antarctic continent, " Case said in a statement.
[2] Antarctic sea ice, for instance, does not seem to be shrinking, probably because increased melting is balanced by more snow.
[3] Late 1911, early 1912, there was a race to be the first to the South Pole: the heart of the Antarctic continent.

candle.definition::
[n.] 蜡烛
[v.] 用亮光检查(鸡蛋的)好坏
[网络] 烛光；烛形物；蜡蠋
candle.example::
[1] Absence diminishes small loves and increases great ones, as the wind blows out the candle and blows up the bonfire.
[2] Caroline took a candle , and went quietly all over the house , seeing that every window was fast and every door barred .
[3] Absence extinguishes small passions and increases great ones, as the wind blows out a candle, and fans a bonfire.

smash.definition::
[v.] 粉碎；破碎；扣杀；捣毁
[n.] 扣球；打碎；破碎；破碎（或打碎）的哗啦声
[adv.] 轰然
[网络] 名声大噪；打破；打烂
smash.example::
[1] 'I was upset by what was happening, and I thought as I went out the door: "I'd smash a plate over your head if you were my husband! "
[2] At the front was a sharp point of iron that could smash through the sides of wooden ships. The Virginia could not move fast.
[3] He said that it made him uneasy to see my silver so insecure in the breakfront, where any intruder could smash the glass.

torrent.definition::
[n.] 急流；激流；洪流；湍流
[网络] 种子；种子文件；奔流
torrent.example::
[1] Speaking to analysts last month, he said the torrent of money being bet in Macao is already lagging the casino capacity coming online.
[2] Up to Brig, the Rhone is a torrent, and then becomes a great mountain river running southwest through a glacier valley.
[3] Twenty minutes later, all that changed. Grandmother walked by the bathroom and noticed a torrent of water streaming out from under the door.

settlement.definition::
[n.] 解决；结算；处理；移民
[网络] 和解；清算；居民点
settlement.example::
[1] We returned to the States where he took charge of a settlement house in Brooklyn, New York.
[2] Mr. Netanyahu did not comment on the settlement freeze but added a demand of his own.
[3] And its debt is still increasing; the Bank for International Settlement says it will grow to 3 times GDP over the next 10 years.

immerse.definition::
[v.] 使浸没于；（使）深陷于
[网络] 沉浸；浸入；使沉浸在
immerse.example::
[1] Lee said that it took time for Wang to immerse himself in character, but that he was delighted by his progress.
[2] After moving to Belgium, he studied art and began to immerse himself in Japanese paintings.
[3] Dear you open mouth, in the wind the words want to be able to let you immerse.

champion.definition::
[n.] 冠军；捍卫者；拥护者；优胜者
[v.] 捍卫；为…而斗争；声援
[adj.] 〈口〉头等的；非常的
[网络] 斗士；得胜者；倡导者
champion.example::
[1] On her own, the Captain of the Watch is a decently strong piece. Being a Champion lets her spread some of that strength across the war band.
[2] Consumers find it hard to measure how much energy they use, says Jonathan Stearn of Consumer Focus, a customer champion.
[3] ODDLY for such a champion of family values, Mitt Romney once threw stones at his wife.

dare.definition::
[auxv.] 敢
[v.] 敢于；胆敢；激（某人做某事）；问（某人）有没有胆量（做某事）
[n.] 挑战；激将
[网络] 竟敢；敢不敢；大胆
dare.example::
[1] If you don't believe me I, dare you to go out with the "nice guy" and tell me the experience was a bad one.
[2] In the journey of chasing a dream, in the realization of the value of the journey of life, the moment did not dare to relax.
[3] She did not dare to bike down the abrupt slope.

arrive.definition::
[v.] 到达；出现；到…；达到(结果)
[网络] 抵达；来临；来到
arrive.example::
[1] Time that Chinese waste in learning English is too many, the degree that arrive to have no necessity and did not make sense much.
[2] As for the question of when the train would arrive, none of the clerks at the ticket office bothered to answer.
[3] Short of an unexpected delay on his way, he'll arrive by tomorrow.

insurance.definition::
[n.] 保险；保险业；保险费；保费
[adj.] 胜券在握的
[网络] 保险学；保险界；保险单
insurance.example::
[1] Information about insurance. Calculations to find out how much life insurance is needed. Life.
[2] Additional documents relevant to the claim may BE required and to BE forwarded upon request of Eagle Star Insurance Co. Ltd. (The Company).
[3] Keyman insurance recognises that any business is likely to have one or two members who play a particularly key role in the company.

luxury.definition::
[n.] 奢侈品；奢华；奢侈的享受；不常有的乐趣（或享受、优势）
[adj.] 奢华的
[网络] 豪华；豪华型；华贵
luxury.example::
[1] Never was there such a bed, the luxury of a princess, such a bed as she had dreamed about her whole life.
[2] Certainly not directly -- you'd never say something like this directly. But any flash luxury brand is going to be embraced by these women.
[3] After a week on the Maharajas' Express, India's new luxury train, the 7. 57 from Stoneleigh to Clapham Junction was a bit of a comedown.

helpless.definition::
[adj.] 无自理能力的；不能自立的；无助的；无法抑制的
[网络] 无奈；无能的；无援
helpless.example::
[1] Between the time of his arrest and his trial for that offense, the judge released the helpless-looking old man into his sister's custody.
[2] Seems to have be eliminated by social feeling helpless, but there is a intention of dawn is coming led me to continue to go forward.
[3] But when the work is not into the heart, because of my ideal and reality always has a big gap with great access to let me feel helpless.

catholic.definition::
[adj.] 全体基督教徒的；基督教会的；包罗万象的；广泛的
[n.] 旧教徒；(尤指)天主教徒；旧教信奉者
[网络] 天主教的；普遍的；天主教教徒
catholic.example::
[1] The holy Christian church is all believers in heaven and on earth, whether Lutheran, Catholic, Baptist, Jew, Mormon, or Methodist.
[2] For the Roman Catholic and Orthodox Christian Churches, it was like an endorsement from Europe's top rock stars.
[3] The guilt he felt as a result of his strong Roman Catholic upbringing gnawed constantly at him.
